Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior glazed black around tondo, which is surrounded by frieze of alternate red and black outlined tongues between triple bands; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of panther to right (head lost; incised spots with added white centres all over body and legs), hind paws resting on stylized lotus, front paws on ground line; exterior: glazed black.
Curator's comments: For parallels with other animals and plants, see British Museum 1847,0806.44 and 1860,0201.36.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.37)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 420, no. B656)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 234, no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0549) (Phase 1)
